intro: Euonymus pleurostylioides, commonly known as the pleurostiloid euonymus, is a flowering plant native to China. It belongs to the family Cercidaceae and is characterized by its small, deciduous leaves and clusters of yellowish-white flowers. The plant produces small, fleshy fruits that are typically red or orange in color. It is often grown as an ornamental plant due to its attractive foliage and seasonal blooms. Euonymus pleurostylioides prefers well-drained soil and partial shade, making it suitable for woodland gardens.
